Sequence Information.Peptide Name: 2K2L (Temporin-1CEc analog, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, Leu-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, amphibians, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (69.23%) toTemporin-1CEcK=L: 31%, P: 15%.Chemical modification: C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 25 uM),  P. aeruginosa (MIC 6.25uM), E. aerogenes (MIC 3.13 uM), E.cloacae (MIC > 100 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 25 uM), S. aureus (MIC 25 uM), B. cereus (MIC 1.56 uM), S.lactis (MIC >100 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 3.13 uM), E. faecium (MIC 1.56 uM).  Also inhibited biofilm formation:bacteria:S. epidermidis.MOA:bacteria:S. epidermidis: permeated bacterial membranes.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE or 30 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: Human RBC: HC50 >500 uM, little hemo.lytic.
Literature Information.Author: Ji F, Zhao Y, Jiang F, Shang D. 2022
Literature Information.Title: Membrane mechanism of temporin-1CEc, an antimicrobial peptide isolated from the skin secretions of Rana chensinensis, and its systemic analogs.
